de2ac32ff0c699f2c1f59e3a293f716a (02:13): When I go to add a few more rows to my table right, how do i continue to use the auto incrementer?
de2ac32ff0c699f2c1f59e3a293f716a (02:14): is that how I do that?
8ca5f57f9239eb0480ae69739a49c953 (02:17): if it's a standard auto_increment column, you'd just need to specify the non-id column in the columns list, and leave the id column out
8ca5f57f9239eb0480ae69739a49c953 (02:17): and auto_increment will handle inserting the new id transparently
de2ac32ff0c699f2c1f59e3a293f716a (02:17): so just add in all other stuff, and dont add in anything inside the column which was set as the auto incrementer?
de2ac32ff0c699f2c1f59e3a293f716a (02:17): and it should fill in itself?
de2ac32ff0c699f2c1f59e3a293f716a (02:17): k ill try that, thank you.
8ca5f57f9239eb0480ae69739a49c953 (02:17): and if it didn't, half my code at work should fail :p

de2ac32ff0c699f2c1f59e3a293f716a (02:59): i have a question on my lab that states that I have to add 8 rows into the table that i created and it says i have to continue to use the auto_incrementer.  However when I go to add in another row, the auto_incrementer adds the row to the top and the ID is 0 and not starting at the next number in the column, any ideas why it's doing that?
